citation.article-title: Ferrimicrobium acidiphilum gen. nov., sp. nov. and Ferrithrix thermotolerans gen. nov., sp. nov.: heterotrophic, iron-oxidizing, extremely acidophilic actinobacteria.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Ferrimicrobium (Fer.ri.mi.cro′bi.um. L. neut. n. ferrum iron; N.L. neut. n. microbium microbe; N.L. neut. n. Ferrimicrobium iron microbe).
Cells are motile rods, Gram-negative, and do not form spores.
Capable of oxidation and reduction of iron and oxidation of pyrite.
Grows with yeast extract or a limited range of organic compounds.
Sequence analysis of the 16S rRNA gene places the genus within the subclass of Acidimicrobidae in the Actinobacteria.
The major fatty acids are i-C16 : 0, i-C14 : 0, i-C15 : 0, ai-C15 : 0 and C17 : 1ω6c.
The dominant menaquinone is MK-8(H10), with minor amounts of MK-8 and MK-8(H10) containing one or two methyl groups also detected.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA is approx. 55 mol%.
The type species is Ferrimicrobium acidiphilum.
